content.question:
<math alttext="f of x, equals, x squared, minus 4 x, plus 4, for x less than 2; f of x, equals 3, for x equals 2; f of x, equals x squared, minus 4 x, plus 8, for x greater than 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the piecewise function defined above. The value of <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the right, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is

topic.text: 1.5: Determining Limits Using Algebraic Properties of Limits

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
